pr_title: added role for admin in user chassis properties

timeline.message:
added role for admin in user chassis properties

Signed-off-by: marius-patrascu <marius-florin.patrascu@ing.com>

timeline.bodyText: i believe "all" is unnecessary, we should stick with @bogdan-sava's approach when user doesn't have anything configured it will default to provide access to everything
timeline.author: sarbull
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -59,7 +59,8 @@ authentication.mode=token
 # component visibility for different roles
 # these properties are used to create a model for UI to show or hide components
 # role.visibleComponents.ROLE_NAME=coma,separate,values
-role.visibleComponents.USER=asset-catalog,about
+role.visibleComponents.USER=asset-catalog,about,asset-lineage,vertical-lineage
+role.visibleComponents.ADMIN=all

replies.bodyText:
I feel like this approach is more "mistake proof". In case someone forgets to configure the permissions for a role it should not get access to everything, the permissions for accessing everything should be given knowingly.
I have discussed this this approach with @bogdan-sava and we agreed that this is a better handling of the "admin" role.
replies.author: marius-patrascu

replies.bodyText: @marius-patrascu the user should initially have a ROLE attached, such as "ADMIN" or "USER", so this means that "all" is still irrelevant if the role includes it or not
replies.author: sarbull

timeline.message:
if admin permision is present, override the rest
